result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie J. Boen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:38 pm Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf168, 16cf79, 15cf241 and 15cf29. Schiek statement. Court remits costs.

In 16cf79 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to misdemeanor bail jumping - Granted.

16cm225 - State moves to dismiss in its entirety - Granted.
16cf168 - State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 2 to misdemeanor bail jumping.
15cf241 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 2 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to misdemeanor bail jumping. 
  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Off record for scheduling. 10:33 a.m. - Sentencing hearing scheduled. Bail continued. Adj. 10:33 a.m. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:31 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Katie J. Boen in custody. Schiek statement to motion for release pending appeal. Laska statement to motion - requests modification to JOC to impose and stay remainder of sentence. Court finds that history of case has been to drag out matter -changing counsel, changing mind on day of plea and requesting jury trial - Court denies motion for release pending appeal. Adj. 3:44 p.m.

3:13 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf29, 16cf85, 15cf168, 16cf79, 15cf241 and 16cm225. Schiek statement - no global resolution - will proceed to sentencing today in 15cf29. Burns statement that she believes resolution is close - defendant needs a little more time to consider agreement in other matters. Schiek statement on sentencing - Exhibits 1 and 2 marked (letters). G.B., victim's aunt, statement on sentencing. G.F., victim's grandmother, statement on sentencing. Burns statement on sentencing  - Defense Exhibit 3 (letters) marked. Court statement on sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP-3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 60 days with Huber for all purposes. Will allow release for child visitation purposes. Remand immediately.

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given. 

All other cases  - next hearing date is August 2, 2016 at 3:00 p.m.
In 16cm225 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Court sets $500 signature bond. Next hearing - August 2, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 
Bail continued in other matters. 
Adj. 4:02 p.m.
Defense - character reference letter

1:29 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf29, 16cf79, 15cf241, 16cf85, 15cf168. Attorney Mary Burns is present in Court. Burns statement that she will be representing on 16cf79 and 16cf85. Schiek/Rielly statement - ready to proceed to sentencing - Rielly files character statement for sentencing. Defendant statement that she does not want to proceed to sentencing today - would like Attorney Burns to have time to review as all the cases are connected. Schiek statement to proceed today on sentencing; can then work on global resolution of other cases; if sentencing does not proceed today - would possibly want a PSI. Rielly moves to withdraw from 15cf29, 15cf241 and 15cf168 - Granted. Court to allow Burns to investigate whether she is eligible to represent in all cases. Court does not require PSI. Court will not allow an additional adjournment on sentencing. 1:40 p.m. Off record for scheduling. 1:42 p.m. Pre-trial conference on June 7, 2016 on all matters except 15CF29- if matters are resolved - sentencing on that date on all matters.  Parties stipulate that Court will be provided with copies of Social Services records. Rights to preliminary hearings are not waived - if matters are not resolved - on June 7, 2016 preliminary hearings will be scheduled. Court advises defendant that sentencing will proceed on June 7, 2016 with or without an attorney present - if defendant does not want Attorney Burns to represent - will still proceed to sentencing. Defendant requests bond condition in 16cf79 of no scheduled visitation with child of Mr. Marshall to be removed - Attorney Fugel present in court - no CHIPS case regarding child of Marshall/Boen - there is a family case scheduled for hearing next week - Court modifies bond condition removing scheduled visitation with minor child  and adds must comply with all family court orders.  Attorney Fugel/Court discussion on documentation to be provided to Court - copies of all documents to be submitted to Court shoud be provided to Attorney Burns. Adj. 1:50 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing at 04-08-2016 01:30 pm
Juror question

ALL EXHIBITS KEPT IN EXHIBIT DRAWER
State's Exh. 1 - Photo/full page
State's Exh. 2 - Photo/2 on page
State's Exh. 3 - Photo/full page
State's Exh. 4 - Transcript of interview of EJF
State's Exh. 5 - DVD Interview (previously marked as State's Exh. 1 on 1/27/16 hrg.0
Defendant's Exh. 6 - Copy of photo of sofa/recliner
Jury Selection & Peremptory Challenges

4:59 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reads verdict--defendant found guilty. Court polls jurors. Court statement to jurors, thanks them for their time. Bond continued. 5:03 p.m. adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:02 p.m. In Chambers - present Michael Schiek, Michael Rielly, defendant and Deputy Erikson. Schiek statement to potential contact by juror - Court reminds Deputy Erikson still under oath - Erikson statement to contact after recess for lunch - not sure it was a juror - Rielly/Schiek questions to defendant. Court - will play video for jury; officer to determine if contact was by juror and to notify Court- Court will then determine if juror will need to be excused. 1:11 p.m.
Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1:14 p.m. - Schiek has transcripts for jurors/judge - Rielly no objection. Off record 1:14 p.m.
1:17 p.m - Court addresses issue taken up in chambers. Erikson statement - person that approached him was not a juror but a spectator in gallery - Ginger Fairfield - paternal grandmother. 1:19 p.m. - Jurors return. Court statement to DVD - jury instruction re DVD recording given to jury. Exhibit 4 (transcript) - marked. Schiek - Starting video at 6 minutes, 07 seconds. Video ended at 26 minutes, 15 seconds. Deputy Adams recalled. Direct by Schiek. Schiek moves to admit Exhibits 1-4 - Rielly has no objection - Granted. Exhibit 5 (DVD previously marked as Exhibit 1 on 1/27/16) - marked- received.
1:45 p.m. State rests - Transcripts collected by baliff. 
1:46 p.m. Jurors out. Schiek motion for other evidence - Court - if offered for impeachment purposes - denied. Court withholding further ruling. Recess 1:52 p.m.
2:09 p.m. - Rielly states defendant will testify - prior convictions information given to Court - Rielly - defendant will admit to 3 convictions - Court rules that answer will be 2 - does not believe that OWI-2nd meets statutory requirements. Court has provided jury instructions to counsel. Schiek - 315 to be removed. 
2:14 p.m. - Jurors return. Defense calls Katie Boen/sworn/direct by Rielly - Exhibit 6 (photo of reclining sofa) marked  /cross by Schiek/redirect by Rielly - Rielly moves for admission of Exhibit 6-no objection by Schiek - published to jury. 
2:35 p.m. Defense rests. Side bar. 
2:39 p.m. Jurors out.
2:40 p.m. - Schiek statement to side bar - Instructions to be given - 100, 2109, 140, 145, 103, 157, 155, 190, 195, 300, 340, 327, 160, 465, verdict form - Counsel stipulates - Recess 2:46 p.m.
2:57 p.m.  Instruction 515 added. 2:58 p.m.  - Jurors return - Instructions given to jurors.
3:07 p.m. - Closing Statement - Schiek 
3:15 p.m. - Closing Statement - Rielly
3:20 p.m. - Rebuttal - Schiek
3:23 p.m. - Further instructions to jury. 
3:26 p.m. - Jurors out for deliberation. Instruction 155 not given to jury. Exhibits not given to jury. Adj. 3:28 p.m.

8:33 a.m. In chambers - Defendant present - jury in courtroom watching video
Rielly - statement that extensive negotiations have been held for resolution - final offer of settlement discussed as recently as yesterday - Defendant has rejected offer - Schiek - pursuant to State v. Ludwig, defendant's knowledge, understanding and rejection of plea should be put on record. Defendant acknowledges plea offer and rejects. Schiek - motion that BL be ordered to testify - was served with subpoena but is requesting order to testify due to confidential matters of employment - Court will entertain motion after jury selected. State motion to allowing transcript of DVD audio to be presented to jury to follow along with audio - Rielly has no objections but has not reviewed transcript - Court will allow transcript after review/stipulation by Rielly. Schiek/Rielly stipulate to period of DVD to be payed to jury. Jury instructions discussed. Rielly - motion to allow mother of defendant be allowed in courtroom during trial - State no objections - Court grants-all witnesses will be sequestered with exception of mother. Rielly requests time if necessary to meet with his client - granted. Schiek - motions in limine regarding prior convictions - Court - will be determined if defendant decides to testify. 8:46 a.m.


8:53 a.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:54 a.m. - case called - Jurors sworn - 20 jurors sworn
8:59 a.m. Inroduction of counsel - Schiek
9:00 a.m. Introduction of counsel - Rielly
9:00 a.m. Voir Dire - Court - #771 - stricken for cause #33 drawn - 
9:14 a.m. Voir Dire - Schiek - 
9:30 a.m. Voir Dire - Rielly - 
9:31 a.m. - Peremptory strikes commencing - Preliminary jury instructions given to jury.
9:39 a.m. - 12 jurors selected/sworn to serve on trial 
9:40 a.m. - Jurors excused recess

9:59 a.m. - Court statement to issue with a juror potentially working with a witness - #33 informed baliff of 10-year old working relationship - Rielly - defendant worked with juror 523 - over 10 years ago - Court had asked jurors if they knew defendant - no response - Schiek/Rielly have no follow-up for juror #33
Shieck - statement to BL's testimony - Court questions Mike Fugle re testimony- Court orders BL to testify
10:04 a.m. - Jurors return
10:06: - Opening statement - Schiek
10:09 a.m. - Opening statement - Rielly
10:12 a.m. - State calls Brenda Lee, Oneida County Social Worker - sworn/direct by Schiek - Exhibit 1 - marked (picture of EF eye) - received. Cross by Rielly. Redirect by Schiek. BL released from subpoena.
10:31 a.m. - State calls Sgt. Brian Erikson, Oneida County Sheriff's Department/sworn/direct by Schiek - witness ID's defendant /Cross by Rielly. Schiek motion to retain witness under subpoena for potential rebuttal testimony.
10:51 a.m. - State calls MB/sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Rielly - 
11:06 a.m. - State calls Oneida County Deputy James Adams/sworn/direct by Schiek/Exhibits 2 and 3 marked (photos) - received. Exhibits 2 and 3 published to jury. Cross by Rielly. Jurors recessed for lunch 11:23 a.m. - jurors to return at 1:00 p.m. 
Schiek statement - based on MB's testimony - would like to show additional video/audio - to dispute. Rielly statement to allegation on DVD. Schiek -prior bad acts - Rielly - more prejudical than probative. Court will withhold decision - will need to review evidence prior to decision. Rielly has no objection to transcript be provided to jury. State will bring victim to courthouse unless Rielly stipulates will not be calling as witness. Adj. 11:34 a.m.
State's Exh. 1 - 1/23/15 DVD interview of EJF - DVD KEPT IN PAPER COURT FILE AT THIS TIME, may be needed for JT/bjb

11:09 a.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF168/15CF241 as status. Court statement--hrg. to admit audio/video recording under s. 908.08. Court received DVD 1/26/16 and has reviewed. State's Exh. 1 (01/23/15 Interview of EJF) marked, offered. Schiek calls Deputy James Adams, ONSO, sworn, direct. Cross by Rielly/questioned by the Court. Court statement--reads from s. 908.08; court allows admission of DVD recording/received; child be made available for cross-examination. Court requests jury instruction numbers from counsel 1/28/16. Bond continued.

2:13 p.m. Defendant Katie J. Boen in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin specially on behalf of DA Schiek. State requests audiovisual recording of children at trial. Court statement--references 908.08. Rielly objects to DVD. Court statement--reviews statute/advises he needs confirmation no alterations to video. Court takes motion under advisement/need to have various proofs; State to provide witness or written statement/summary of DVD.  Oral ruling scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
to allow audiovisual recordings and statements of children at trial pursuant to Sec. 908.08
